text: all right here's our basic peanut
dressing and again this is I say basic
Pina dressing because sometimes we take
this and we add other things to it
depending on the dish but here we go
half a cup of peanut butter smooth of
course all right that was one clove of
garlic that I crushed you can mince it
but I like the garlic press the juice of
two limes okay so a couple ounces of
lime juice and that's a good squirt of
hot sauce I'm using an Asian sriracha
style about a teaspoon and there's my
pure sesame oil about 12 drops I prefer
the pure sesame oil to the impure all
right so a few drips of that and then
the main component here along with the
lime we're going to put another acid
which is the seasoned rice vinegar so
I'm going to go with a half a cup of
seasoned rice vinegar and remember this
already has a little good amount of salt
in it and some sugar so I'm not putting
any additional salt in this now in the I
warn you here you're going to think
something is wrong when you start
stirring this because it's going to be
totally separated it's going to look
disgusting it's not going to come
together and you're going to think you
did something wrong it's because the
peanut butter is cold and it doesn't
really mix well with the vinegar but
you'll see you stir it for two minutes
and the peanut butter will dissolve and
warm up a little bit and just be patient
unlike ice a couple minutes later you're
going to see it really comes together
perfectly there we go all right now the
last addition here is going to be a
third of a cup of a neutral vegetable
oil I'm using a canola here but peanut
oil would be fine I guess but just
nothing with any flavor and stir that in
and that's your base and again that can
go to a lot of different directions
depend on what you're making here we
used it for a cold noodle salad with a
spicy Thai style beef on top that video
is also up on the site so check that out
I hope you enjoyed it
